### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Set `$ErrorView = 'NormalView'`

2. Produce an error by issuing for example `Write-Error "blabla"` or `dir "nonexistant path"` 

### Expected behavior

Expected behavior would be that ALL error text is colorized (according to settings in  $host.PrivateData)

### Actual behavior

Main error text in `'NormalView'` is colorized correctly, but the command name and colon is not colorized, as it is in `'ConciseView'` and in PowerShell 5.1.

In addition to this I just discovered that in `'NormalView'`, when entering a command alias, the alias is not exchanged with the full command name as in `'ConciseView'` (but not in PowerShell 5.1). I don't know if this is expected behavior or not, or if it is related to the coloring flaw.

See screenshot.

_No response_
